snippet: German security officials are coming under fire for allowing a Tunisian man they believe may have served as a bodyguard to Osama bin Laden in 2000 to live in western Germany for years.
abstract: German security officials come under fire for allowing a Tunisian man they believe may have served as a bodyguard to Osama bin Laden in 2000 to live in western Germany for years; authorities insist they have done everything possible to curtail the activities of the man, who advocates extreme jihadist views.
lead_paragraph: German security officials are coming under fire for allowing a Tunisian man they believe may have served as a bodyguard to Osama bin Laden in 2000 to live in western Germany for years.

headline.main: Germany: Criticism Over Man Suspected as Bin Laden Guard
headline.print_headline: Germany: Criticism Over Man Suspected as Bin Laden Guard
